step: Read and analyze backend dependencies from pom.xml and confirm project structure.
sub_steps: Open /home/coder/project/workspace/question_generation_service/solutions/393df57b-a0fa-4fc3-9e91-4ebdb2c8bac3/springapp/pom.xml.
Verify that dependencies for Spring Web, Spring Data JPA, MySQL Connector, and validation are present.
Familiarize with initial Spring Boot source structure in /springapp/src/main/java/com/examly/springapp/.
description: Ensures all required backend libraries are available and understand entrypoints for adding entities, repositories, services, and controllers.

step: Implement backend entity classes for Group, Member, and Expense with correct relationships.
sub_steps: Create Group, Member, and Expense entities using JPA annotations and ensure referential integrity.
Group must have unique groupName, member list, and expense list.
Member must reference group; Expense must reference group and payer (member).
description: Foundation data model for the expense splitter; enables persistence and relationship management for groups, members, and expenses.

step: Create repository interfaces for Group, Member, and Expense.
sub_steps: Define GroupRepository, MemberRepository, and ExpenseRepository extending JpaRepository with query methods as necessary.
Add methods for finding by groupName and other lookups for relationship validation.
description: Adds data access layer for efficient CRUD and custom queries on persisted model objects.

step: Implement backend service layer with business logic for group and expense management.
sub_steps: Create GroupService and ExpenseService for handling logic (group creation, adding members, validating payer, expense splitting, calculating balances).
Enforce group name uniqueness, member existence, amount validation, and exception handling as specified.
Ensure error messages and logic match test cases for validation.
description: Centralizes application logic and validation, ensuring a clean separation between controller and repository. Handles all required constraints and computational logic.

step: Create REST controllers for group and expense operations with required endpoints and error handling.
sub_steps: Design endpoints for creating group, adding member, adding expense, fetching group details including expenses and balances.
Implement validation error responses with proper error format and HTTP status codes as required.
Add global exception handling to standardize JSON error responses.
Enable CORS for frontend requests.
description: Exposes backend services as RESTful APIs with JSON responses and error handling conforming to requirements for frontend integration and automated testing.

step: Implement JUnit test cases for backend logic and endpoints as required by test cases JSON.
sub_steps: Create test class for GroupController and ExpenseController.
Implement tests for: testCreateGroupSuccess, testCreateGroupDuplicateName, testAddExpenseSuccess, testAddExpenseInvalidAmount, testGetGroupBalances.
Use MockMvc and proper mocks for repository/service interactions.
Assert response structures, error messages, and returned status codes.
Focus on positive and negative paths as described in each test case.
description: Provides complete automated testing for backend REST endpoints, validating that requirements and error handling match test expectations.

step: Compile, build, and run backend tests
sub_steps: Run mvn clean compile -q -Dspring.main.banner-mode=off inside springapp/
Run mvn test -q -Dspring.main.banner-mode=off to verify backend tests.
Run mvn clean install -q -Dspring.main.banner-mode=off for final build validation.
description: Verifies backend compiles cleanly and all backend test cases pass as required.

step: Read and analyze frontend dependencies from package.json and confirm project structure.
sub_steps: Open /home/coder/project/workspace/question_generation_service/solutions/393df57b-a0fa-4fc3-9e91-4ebdb2c8bac3/reactapp/package.json.
Ensure required dependencies for React, testing-library/react, and Jest are present.
Review src/ directory for App.js and related files.
description: Confirms the React frontend has correct dependencies installed before component implementation.

step: Implement React frontend components, utilities, and styling
sub_steps: Create components: GroupList, GroupDetail, AddMemberForm, AddExpenseForm, Balances.
Handle state management (group selection, member/expense list updates, error messages) at App.js and child components as appropriate.
Implement API calls to backend as specified (using fetch), handle JSON error formats.
Add CSS files for styling (container, forms, buttons, errors) using variables as dictated by design guidelines.
Use data-testid attributes as needed for test selectors.
description: Implements all required UI features for group/expense management, state, and display; ensures modern design and minimal styling for usability and testability.

step: Implement Jest test cases for frontend components as per test cases JSON.
sub_steps: For GroupList.js, create rendersGroupList test to check both groups appear in DOM.
For GroupDetail.js, create rendersMembersInGroup test to check all member names appear.
For AddExpenseForm.js, create addExpenseFormValidation test to verify form validation and error message rendering.
For Balances.js, create displaysBalancesCorrectly test to ensure member names and correct balances display.
Handle handlesDuplicateGroupError scenario (simulate API error and assert UI error message 'Group name already exists').
Create/modify .test.js files for each component and mock/fake API calls as needed.
No manual cleanup() calls; use data-testid for all critical elements.
description: Ensures all required frontend tests are in place and passing by testing key rendering, validation, and error logic, fully matching sample data and formats.

step: Install, lint, build, and run Jest tests for frontend.
sub_steps: Run npm install in reactapp/ to install dependencies.
Run npm run build to confirm compilation.
Run npx eslint src/ --fix to lint and autofix code.
Run npm run test:ci to execute tests and verify output.
description: Compiles, lints, and validates that all required frontend components and tests are built and functioning as expected.
